double_jeopardy_round: THE RHYME OF SIR NEVILLE MARRINER

(6, 2).clue: Aristotle claimed that this organ is the coldest in the body, helping it cool the passions of the heart

(1, 1).clue: Sir Neville Marriner, famous conductor/played this classical fiddle & was an instructor

(2, 1).clue: A hangman's loop lops off an "O" & turns into a body part

(4, 1).clue: In phonetics, these can be pulmonic, like T or F, or non-pulmonic, like clicks

(5, 1).clue: William Henry Harrison gave the longest inaugural speech in history; this man in 1793 at his second gave the shortest

(6, 1).clue: The name of this large sea comes from words for "middle of the land"
